thread.title: Ethiopia: Parliament, EPP Discuss Bilateral Ties
thread.title_full: Ethiopia: Parliament, EPP Discuss Bilateral Ties

title: Ethiopia: Parliament, EPP Discuss Bilateral Ties
text:
Kenya: Obama Team Takes Over State House 
The delegation raised various questions regarding the arrangement of the Ethiopian parliament, ethnic representation, key priority of the parliament and the like. 
Shitaye said that infrastructural development such as provision of electricity, health and educational services have long been the priority areas in the move to end poverty. 
The Deputy Speaker also said that the Parliament is a representation of nations, nationalities and peoples of the country whose task is mainly to legislate laws and monitor ongoing activities in various sectors. 
Concerning the participation of opposition political parties in national issues with the ruling wining 100 per cent seat in the recent election, the Deputy Speaker said that there are many arrangements in which political parties are entitled to reflect their views and stand on national issues at parliamentary and other levels. 
Indicating that migration has been the major challenging factor for the European Union, the delegation also asked about Ethiopia's move towards curbing illegal migration. Responding to the question, Shitaye said that the government through micro and small enterprises is creating numerous job opportunities for citizens to work and change their lives at home. 
The delegation also discussed bilateral ties between Ethiopia and EU focusing on proper utilization of fund and aid. In this regard, Shitaye told the delegates that Ethiopia is effectively utilizing funds and aid for sustainable development particularly in the provision of water, agricultural development and the like. 
As to Shitaye, Ethiopia enjoys harmonious relations with neighbouring countries except with the regime in Eritrea and is also working with the international community in the fight against terrorism. 
Noting that differences exist among EU members on certain issues, the Chairperson said that EU has strong bilateral relations with Ethiopia in the area of development. EU is also desirous of boosting cooperation in investment and curbing human trafficking. 
Ethiopia is playing a leading role in ensuring peace and stability in the region particularly in Somalia and other countries, he said. 
Weber said that Ethiopia should continue maintaining its stability putting illegal migration at the forefront. He also called for the creation of open and free society through strengthening freedom of speech and democracy. Ethiopia
